website_summaries.verdict: Reduces neck and shoulder pain from squats, but slides off easily for classes where you need to change weights often.
pros: Remains securely fastened during lifts, but is easy to take on and off
Thick, high density, non-slip rubber-foam absorbs impact and reduces pain
Can be applied to all Olympic sized barbells
Ergonomic design takes weight off your neck and redistributes to shoulders
cons: No straps to hold shut, so the bar can slide out
A bit bulky for some exercises

customer_reviews.title: Careful with alignment
customer_reviews.text: I was gonna give 3 stars, but I do really like this product, although next time I'll get one with Velcro so it's stays on the bar better. I was doing hip ups with 45 plates on each side the other day and this thing popped off and my hips were really bruised from the Olympic bar falling on them. Now I'm just really careful of the placement before I do any exercises. It's really supportive otherwise and that's the only time I haven't been a fan of it.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa R.

customer_reviews.title: I love this squat pad and I wish I went with ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this squat pad and I wish I went with it from the beginning. I initially purchased a thinner, smaller squat pad for my hip thrusts & glute bridges which worked out great until I started lifting ~ 125lbs on my hips. Once I increased my weight over 125lbs I had to look for a different sponge and I'm extremely happy with the BEAR Strength & Conditioning Sponge. I wish I opted for it from the beginning. Word of advice: if you know for sure you'll eventually use higher weights - than it's worth investing in a higher quality sponge. Otherwise, a smaller sponge would be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, although I've only used this product a couple of times. It is quite cushiony and I feel like it makes it easier for me to do my exercises. So far I'm squatting about 185 lbs. I barely feel the bar when I lift. My neck feels pretty good at the end of the day, where as before my neck was feeling very sore. I'm glad I got this pad. It feels like it has more support than other popular brands I've used. I get to focus less on the uncomfortable neck pain and more on my movements.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Spins on the barbell, not good for hip thrusts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pad primarily for hip thrusts but found that it would constantly spin on the bar, making it difficult to use :( I don't use a pad for squats and lunges, but even then I could see that the spinning could be a problem. My only regret is that I forgot to return this to Amazon to get a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: RVS

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but price was a little high
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this brand 1st. It really makes hip-thrusts and squats painless - so much better than trying to use a towel. Liked it so much I decided to buy another for my home gym. That's when I found another band, for about half the cost that works just as well. They've both do a great job and have held up great. I guess I can't complain, because I was willing to buy another at the same price -- just happened to find a better deal. I will say, you might want to measure your gym locker and make sure you get one that fits. I have to bend mine to fit in.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoMom

customer_reviews.title: works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: after shoulder surgery I needed some extra padding to continue squatting there's a huge chunk cut out of the pad for reasons unknown so if it spins on you while getting under the bar it could pop off. I had to align it multiple times. This pad is really no different from insulating pads you put on exposed pipes; you just need a slice on one side and it will fit over the bar no problem. outside of that design flaw, the product worked great and felt very comfortable on my shoulders allowing me to continue squatting
customer_reviews.author: James415

customer_reviews.title: As a petite woman this barbell pad is perfect for when I am lifting
customer_reviews.text: As a petite woman this barbell pad is perfect for when I am lifting! It is so thick and comfortable that I am able to focus more on my form and reps instead of how uncomfortable the barbell is. It fits perfectly around the pre-weighted barbells but does not completely close together on the squat rack or smith machine bars, which is ok with me. I just make sure the gap is facing up and I don't have any problems. This is a must have if you have any issues with barbells being uncomfortable while lifting!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good cushion but doesn't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this slides onto my bar for squats and hip thrusts. The downside is that it easily slides around and comes off in the middle of my reps. Part of the issue is I am using a standard (not Olympic sized) bar. I picked up some straps to help old it in place which is somewhat effective. The cushion it provides is beneficial and has definitely made it more comfortable for performing these exercises I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian P

customer_reviews.title: c-section mamas!
customer_reviews.text: After having a cesarean birth a couple years ago I’ve had so much trouble doing any type of hip thrusts. The bar is always right on my scar! I am extremely satisfied with this barbell pad! It has a dip in the middle which reduces pressure on my scar. The pad sits firmly on my hips. I can COMFORTABLY do hip thrusts in leg day again! If you’re struggling with a horizontal c-section scar this is the answer to your booty gain dreams.
customer_reviews.author: Ali B

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’m just a beginner at the gym and especially lifting. My friend recommended this as I am just getting the hang of lifting heavy objects. This is great! Protects me from any hurt and I especially like it when I do my hip thrusts (my poor pelvic bone). I do recommend this and can’t beat the price plus quick shipping! It does roll around a bit when you lift. I believe there are straps to keep it from moving but it’s not a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: dubchika

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this yesterday for the first time. The gym has their own version but it hurts my neck and knees because it causes me to pitch forward at a weird angle. There was no knee popping yesterday at all, and it was very comfortable. I got a lot of strange looks from the guys in the gym (weight rooms are male dominated), but one guy, who was looking really hard, I just rotated the logo to face the mirror and I pointed and smiled like Vanna White. I think he got the message lol I won't be surprised to see more of these showing up!
customer_reviews.author: Me!

customer_reviews.title: Nothing compares
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at literally ALL of the resistance bands amazon had to offer. This is the one. It’s sturdy and can handle heavy weight with hip thrusts. Although it doesn’t come with straps to keep it closed, it stays in place and you’d really have to be reckless to let this thing slip and let the bar hit your hip bones during a hip thrust. The most important thing about this product is the padding, but too much padding can limit range of motion. This is the *perfect* size and padding for heavy weight hip thrusts. It’s wide too and covers my hip bones entirely!
customer_reviews.author: George Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size straps & upside down logo but good pad
customer_reviews.text: I bought a replacement barbell pad due to my old one wearing out over time. This one has good thickness and support but I have to dock it two stars for two reasons - the logo is upside down which doesn't affect the functionality but is just unprofessional and annoying to look at. The other reason is the supplied velcro straps are too small and cannot be used since the fuzzy section touches each other when fully tightened down. I threw them away and used the straps from my old barbell pad which fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Kaon

customer_reviews.title: Works for Thrusts
customer_reviews.text: This pad works well for thrusts with a barbell. You’re going to enjoy using this a lot more than the sweat filled old Harbinger pad that you find stuffed between the wall and squat rack at every gym. It’s good at the two main things that matter. 1. It doesn’t slip off the barbell. 2. It provides enough padding.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this thing been all my life!? I bought it based on the recommendation of Whitney Simmons, and I should have known I was going to love it lol in regards to the other reviewers saying the pad keeps falling off of barbells, it just takes a little bit of maneuvering before you do your set to make sure the pad is securely in place. I have not had any problems whatsoever! And I am an avid lifter. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: VWatsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Mobile
customer_reviews.text: Color is vibrant, padding is more than sufficient. But this does NOT fit tightly onto any size bar. Without the straps to hold it onto the bar, it rolls, slips, and has caused quite a few close-calls during my squat regiment. The black straps are helpful, but take about as much effort to get on as my entire workout (exaggeration - but it is difficult).
customer_reviews.author: remington

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This was well-priced and exactly what I was looking for, I was going to give it 4 stars but then I remembered what I paid for it. I bought this as I was tired of the squat bar digging into me when I squat heavy. This fits the bar snug and provides great cushioning when squatting, I'm not sure if it has any other uses but I specifically got it for leg day. One word of caution would be to ensure the opening is facing upwards, if you have the opening facing downwards, then it could slip and may cause harm.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Super comfortable , especially while hipthrusting a lot of weight (which is super important to me and can really hurt your pelvis if there’s not enough padding). Def recommend , high quality and lasts a long time. I actually got this pad over a year ago and stupidly lost it so I had to get it again , but for over a year of heavy work outs it stayed firm and durable- which shows why I looked it up to buy the same one again! Great price and def worth it for fellow workout junkies like me lol👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect on the bar & feels good on shoulders
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for couple weeks now & I have no complaints. Fits perfect on the bar & feels good on shoulders. I like that I don't have to take it off & put back on between squats & benchpress since I use the same bar at my gym. It fits perfectly that it's not in the way on my hands for benchpress yet the pad isn't so big that it's not allowing you to get full range on your bench as you come down to your chest. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Feliciano Rodriguez Jr

customer_reviews.title: All my other gym must haves are super bright and colorful so it fit right in
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I didn't realize I was buying the red ( the picture was black but on futher inspection of listing after receiving the description said red) but it's grown on me. All my other gym must haves are super bright and colorful so it fit right in. I'm able to lift heavier with no upper back/shoulder pain from bar and it is awesome! Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Luna&Meika

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a heavy lifter and unfortunately, being very pale skinned, I tend to bruise horribly. I would use the pads at the gym for my glute bridges and it still look someone took a baseball bat to my groin. This product looked great and I decided to try it out. It's so comfortable, gone are the bruises and it never slips or rotates over the bar like other pads I've used. I can't recommend this enough. I use it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: This barbell pad is excellent in quality
customer_reviews.text: This barbell pad is excellent in quality. It adequately cushions across the shoulders and back for squats and also the hips for hip thrusts. I have had it pop off or rotate once or twice because I wasn't thinking about what direction it faced (I often deadlift, clean, and press my barbell into position for back squats--ie without a rack), but after getting used to it I've learned to make sure the pad opening stays facing upward.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: This barbell pad was great for doing hip thrusts. However, when I used it on the barbell for squats it would slide around and made me off balance. I emailed Kevin about it, and he responded promptly apologizing for this and offered to give me a full refund. The customer service was excellent. He said they are working on a new design and I’m looking forward to purchasing the next one.
customer_reviews.author: A Delo

customer_reviews.title: Support & Comfort protective
customer_reviews.text: I like this pad buy this pad. I dont know what to say although, the comfort I get from using this bar pad versus not using it, is amazing. The material and sponge used on this pad makes it as if your not even carrying a metal bar on your neck. You need this! With the bear bar conditioning and strength im able to go in the next time without thinking a second time about injury.
customer_reviews.author: Resc581

customer_reviews.title: it does pop off the bar :/
customer_reviews.text: It is good quality and feels great, BUT! it does pop off the bar when positioning the bar when using it for back squats. This first time it did it to me it was a shock, now I am much more careful. If I buy another one in the future I will stick with a closed design. For this reason I have to give it three stars, otherwise I'd give it five.
customer_reviews.author: sean nunnink

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE. I have been struggling find a comfortable pad for squats and hip thrusts and this one fits perfect. It’s light weight, seems pretty durable, and very comfortable. Came quickly and in easy opening packaging! The pink color is just as cute in person as it is online! Very pleased :)
customer_reviews.author: Jennalee

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfortable pad
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times at the gym with weights (including bar) up to 215 lbs so far without any problems. The pad is large, but incredibly well cushioned. It's significantly more comfortable than the pads available at the gym. I've only used it about three times so far, so I can't really talk to the long term wear. But from what I've seen so far (and that I only use it about once a week) I expect I'll have the pad for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I REALLY wanted to love this product.....but
customer_reviews.text: This product was received quickly, packed perfectly, and appears to be very well made. The foam is dense, and provides very good cushioning. Too good for me I'm afraid. I've used this pad twice now, and with it installed the bar has a tendency to slide up onto my cervical spine instead of resting comfortably on my upper traps. Guess I go back to the old school towel wrap. :(
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: I can squat heavier now
customer_reviews.text: I love this squat pad, and I wish I would have bought it sooner. I was able to add 20lbs more on my squat...you should definitely give this one a shot, you will not regret it. Ohh and for the person that mentioned the pad rotating when doing hip thrusts, this did not happen to me at all, maybe you should make sure you're using proper form.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Torres

customer_reviews.title: No pain with this pad!!
customer_reviews.text: This pad is AWESOME!! I have been increasing my weight on hip thrusts on the Smith machine (110 lbs now) and the pad at the gym was not cutting it. So I decided to buy my own and I am so happy I chose this pad! It provides ultimate comfort. I feel no pain. I feel confident I can continue increasing my weight with no problems. If your unsure about this pad, rest assured, it's amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and easy to use. I used it for squats and glute bridges and it worked great. I did have a little problem with it popping off for the bridges, just gotta make sure the opening is turned away from your body. Great quality and excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No pain with glut bridges!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job! Durable, well made product. Stays put with the straps are on. I use it for glut bridges and I feel no pain! However, It feels a bit too think for barbell squats. Could be that it’s made for a man with broad shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, durable
customer_reviews.text: I like this product and I use it almost exclusively for hip thrusts/ My local gym had this pad but it eventually started to break apart because it was being used by literally everyone who could get their hands on it. I decided to purchase my own so that I didn't have to wait for the gym to purchase another one nor have to wait for other gym users to finish using it before I could use it. I am very happy with my purchase. (I bought the red-colored pad)
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: I got to the point that I'm lean enough to have no fat around my neck or traps, but strong enough to squat >500 pounds. At this point I needed a pad. I tried this one and it did the job perfectly. I love it. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Coldfire1k

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy hip thrusts!
customer_reviews.text: I use this every week for my hip thrusts and it works amazingly. I’m able to do 190lbs/85kg hip thrusts and not feel it one bit on my hipbones. Also, I use a pretty slim bar and it doesn’t slip or fall off. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela  Pienknagura

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves this pad!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I workout together and where I’m lucky enough that the squat bar doesn’t bother me it creates a lot of pain in her shoulders. She has used this pad twice now and has no pain at all. The redness in the back of her neck on leg day is also gone so at this point it is a great product well worth the money. Also the company emailed us to make sure we were happy with the purchase which in my experience says a lot about how much they think of there customers. I’ve never had a company email me directly so in the future I would buy from them again... hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you love going to the gym and like leg day like me you def need this for yourself. My gym might have one but, it is either already in use or in not good condition. very durable material.
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: It would have been great if it were longer.
customer_reviews.text: It would have been great if it were longer. It looks like a good quality item but is not suited for really wide shoulders. My husband his big and tall and it doesn't provide the comfor and support he needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kawah Saki

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: We have a home gym and have struggled to find something comfortable to put on the bar that won’t kill your neck... found it! This provides comfort and stability so we can work out and enjoy. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: katherine wortham

customer_reviews.title: Good Material
customer_reviews.text: This pad has a nice amount of cushion and really helps relieve that painful pressure that your bar can leave on your shoulders. The only complaint I have is that sometimes it will slide around when you raise it above your head, but it has almost full coverage of the bar so you rarely have to keep track of it. Great addition to my home gym. It doesn't look cheap and the material hasn't cracked or torn.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lagios

customer_reviews.title: Bear Squat Pad
customer_reviews.text: I love this squat bar pad. It has plenty of protection from neck and back pressure points. Once you place it on the bar it stays in place without constant readjustment. I had a bar pad once in the past. It was the kind that pushed onto the bar and had a sleeve that wrapped around with velcro. It would always spin around to the open split and pop off. Not a very secure feeling. The Bear squat pad doesn't move. I confidentally recommend this to anyone doing barbell squats that wants to focus on the movement without the distraction of neck discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: D Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!!! Game changer for hip thrusts and weighted glute bridges, we usually fold a mat like 3 times then try to hold it in place during workouts. This is WAY better. My friend has a c-section scar and says this helps her 100% to reduce the bar pressure. I wish I would have bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great hip thrust pad
customer_reviews.text: I needed a thick pad for hip thrusting in my own gym. I use it at least 3 times per week thrusting between 135-215 lbs and I’ve had no issues with it thinning or the bar hurting my groin area.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for heavy lifting!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this product!!! I’ve been lifting for a few years now and hip thrusts have always been so painful for me, even when using other pads. This one has enabled me to do heavy hip thrusts completely pain free.. the padding is so thick compared to any other brands I’ve tried. No more pain and no more bruises!!!!!!!! This is a game changer
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Palazeke

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for hip thrusters
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to get a hip thruster pad for a while now to avoid having to fold up a mat to use for a substitute, and I am so happy that I finally got one. It is super comfortable, stable, etc. I currently do 155lbs barbell hip thrusters and this pad works like a charm. I just got it so we will have to see how it holds up over time, but so far loving it.
customer_reviews.author: K B

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great quality item. I have a very bony back and just using the bar kills me. I belong to a gym that have the $7 barbell pads but they're AWFUL. They get lumpy after a while and twist when you put them on the bar. I know this pad is $20 but you will not regret it. It's just the right thickness, has great neck support, and stays put when you slide it on. Yes there's about a 1 in gap when you put it on, but it's common sense: don't put that part on your neck. I've only used this a few times, but so far there's no wear on it so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I am very petite, but I like to lift heavy when I squat. I use to hate the way the bar felt on the back of my neck. This product is wonderful, the cushion is great. You just have to be careful that you put it on correctly or else it will start to come off, which can be really distracting when your trying to get your reps in!
customer_reviews.author: Drea

customer_reviews.title: I had the chance to use these for the very ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the chance to use these for the very first time today. While I have been able to do barbell hip thrusts before using rubber mat, it was never as well balanced as using these Bear strength bar bell sponge, also you can't overload since the risk of injury is quite high. Using them was a game changer I was able to do stability drills with 195 lbs and I am sure I will effortlessly be able to incorporate them for squats as well, but for the time being I got my moneys worth by the explosive glute training session today.
customer_reviews.author: Raghu Bhardwaj

customer_reviews.title: What a surprise!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this. What a surprise how thick and tough this pad is! The pic doesn't do it any justice as to how big it really is. You should just buy this and see for yourself. Seriously. If you're looking for a solid pad that provides comfort between you and the bar, then this is the pad for you!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Buy buy buy!
customer_reviews.text: This pad is so soft and durable. I've done a couple of workouts with it and it has saved my neck/back and hips. It does not slide around on the bar or on my shirts/skin. The pad arrived in record time and the seller was great to deal with. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Garrigus

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of looking for this item at the gym I go to. I decided to buy my own. I'm glad I did. It offers great support. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: You NEED this for squats 🔥♥️🔥
customer_reviews.text: Defunatley a must have if you're a gym rat. The crappy ones at 24 are terrible so we had to find something of our own. Plus who wants someone else's sweaty neck on their own ewwww.
customer_reviews.author: Celz

customer_reviews.title: It lasted about a year
customer_reviews.text: I use it 3-4 times per week at the gym doing squats and hip thrusts. After about a year it started cracking and needs to be replaced. Not very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: ZL

customer_reviews.title: Damaged item
customer_reviews.text: My cousin bought this and I tried it out and works perfectly, so I went ahead and bought one myself. I was excited it finally came in only to find out that it has been damaged on the edges. I don’t want to pay full price for a brand new item that doesn’t look brand new at all. I tried emailing customer service but no response.
customer_reviews.author: krystin n

customer_reviews.title: The Go To Pad for Hip Thrust/Glute bridges!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and I used it today as part of my “ operation bring my gluteus back online,” lol. Trying to hit the glute medius so I can get my right femur exteriorly rotated properly so I can get back to front squats. The padding is perfect and did well with 235LBS as of now. Great product;definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SCT

customer_reviews.title: my wife of 48 years loves this!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my wife. she has a problem doing squats with just a towel wrap on the bar. her big problem was a "digging into the c7 vertebra". she has used this pad for over three weeks and her squats and good mornings have gone up over 25%. as a tip she offers for her what works best is to use the "tie down straps" and use just one in the center of the pad with the metal buckle facing up. as a husband of 48 years it is nice to buy a wife something she loves!!!
customer_reviews.author: J W Percifield

customer_reviews.title: Super thick and ok for hip thrusts
customer_reviews.text: Kind of long, it fits in my bag perfectly, its very thick too, I just dont feel it like it helps my pain to relief, at least not yet. I know its job should be this one and I know it works great, just not for me, I still feel some kind of pressure and pain on my hips, that s why they are always sore the next day. I haven t tried them yet for squats, my main goal were the hipthrust and it’s oke but not great. Still kept it tho cause it helps a lot, just not enough
customer_reviews.author: Jolie

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this for squats. That's what traps are for. I use this for hip thrusters. It's very comfortable. It holds on to the bar firmly and doesn't slide off. It's affordable. It's a great buy. If you want to use it for squats, I guess it would work. It has the indentations for your neck in it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good for hip extensions, not for squats
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a pad for hip extensions, this works great as it is extra thick. Not sure why anyone would need a pad for squats as you have muscles to carry the load but this is too bulky to be used for that.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Jameson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy squats and hip thrusts have never been so comfortable ( I even squeezed in an extra set of ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a HUGE fan of the product! Heavy squats and hip thrusts have never been so comfortable ( I even squeezed in an extra set of squats tonight because my shoulders WEREN'T KILLING ME from the pressure of a loaded bar). Plenty of cushion, easy to put on and remove and I haven't had a problem putting it on the different sized bars at the gym. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Xpeaces1201

customer_reviews.title: This pad works exactly as it should. Rides well ...
customer_reviews.text: This pad works exactly as it should. Rides well of the bar for the Smith machine. Gives the padding where it is needed. Hardcore muscle heads accuse me of being "soft." But I tell them I don't need a callous across my shoulders to be a manly man.
customer_reviews.author: David Swoyer

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice pad, but you have to work to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice pad, but you have to work to keep the slot uppermost so that the bar doesn't escape and end up resting directly on your neck as you lower the bar to your shoulders. I was expecting that the inside of the pad would be coated with something to minimize the rotation of the pad, but no.
customer_reviews.author: L. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Left me with nice cute bruises on my hips
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one for hip thrusting awhile back and it lasted a few months then started to rip on the inside and didn’t provide any support so I bought another one and it provides terrible support. I can feel the bar digging into my hips, I literally have bruises on my hip bones because this thing sucks so bad. The first one only lasted longer because I wasn’t doing as heavy of weight. Definitely need to find a better brand and get my money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pad ripped thru the core
customer_reviews.text: I really hate doing this but I purchased this bar of because it was the thickest I can find online on Amazon. After a few months, the pad actually tore while doing what I use it for really: hip thrusts. Because it moved around a bit on the bar, it tore thru the middle and completely all the way thru during a set. I’m not moving crazy weight either, maybe 185-225 and it broke. Wish I can find a thick bar pad that won’t rip now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product, I go heavy on my hip thrusts, and usually with other pads, I can still feel all the pressure and discomfort of the barbell on my pelvic bone and it hurts! This is an awesome barrier and really has such great support, I don’t feel any discomfort or pain whatsoever. I feel at peace now doing my workouts with comfortably❤️ Best barbell pad I have ever tried ! Recommend this 100 percent !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thick foam, well made - Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended to me by a friend. I belong to a very nice health club - but the barbell pads are disgusting! They rotate around and the "foam" is barely there. I use the barbell for hip thrusts and glute bridges, in addition to squats. I needed a nice, thick pad to protect my hip bones. I don't think this picture does the Bear pad justice! I was surprised when it arrived just how thick it is. Well made, the foam doesn't looks like its going to wear down after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mantovani

customer_reviews.title: Liked it
customer_reviews.text: Great square pad, can double for bench press pad too. When I fail to push the last rep, I can rest barbell on chest without problems. It was quite painful support barbell with chest without it. Btw, the inside diameter is 1", so this is designed for regular bar. It would work for Olympic bar, but probably not as good.
customer_reviews.author: yao zhong chen

customer_reviews.title: Cushion Galore
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I would have giving it 5 stars if not for a small concern. I mainly use it for hip thrust on the smith machine and squats. Since using the bar pad have increased the load weight with losing proper form; that a huge plus. The pad it self is very firm not oddly bulky and provides great support my only concern is that there is about a 2inch gap when you applied it onto the bar it does not fully wrap the bar. Although does not slide or move during the exercise, I'm concern it could after normal wear tear, hopefully it would be a while. Other than that its a great product
customer_reviews.author: hola_yadi

customer_reviews.title: Great personal foam support
customer_reviews.text: This helps cushion heavy weighted bars on shoulders. I especially like that I don't need to use the shared foam pad at the gym which is not cleaned thoroughly between uses by different people.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Better than other products, and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: The barbell pad works GREAT! It stayed in place, and it much more comfortable than the smaller, standard pad I've used in the past. I like that the middle part is smaller, to allow room for your neck when using it for back squats. I highly recommend this pad, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Works great for hip thrusts!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for hip thrusts and used it for first time today. Does a much better job of staying in place and cushioning the weighted bar than any of the myriad other bar pads kicking around the gym. Seems like a quality piece and should be durable. Arrived on schedule and is a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mailler, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Barbell Pad!
customer_reviews.text: This barbell pad is SUPER THICK and really is great if you're doing hip thrusts. Because it's so thick, it really cushions against your hips so you can comfortably do more weight without worrying about the bar digging into your hips. Would highly recommend for anyone looking for a more comfortable and reliable barbell pad!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for hip thrusts!
customer_reviews.text: I have a woman's bar from Rogue so this isn't very snug, I wrap tap around it when I need to do hip thrusts and it works great! Definitely better than using a towel or a strip of foam. It does fit around my husband's bar perfect though. I tried it with a back squat and was impressed with the comfort level. I've never used one for squats before. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best purchases I have made for my gym bag
customer_reviews.text: If you're doing squats or hip thrusts and lifting heavy, you need this pad. I only wish I had found out about it sooner. It makes such a difference compared to the dinky one I was using before. This is one of the best purchases I have made for my gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great - I use it especially for hip thrusts and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great - I use it especially for hip thrusts and the like with somewhat heavy weight - haven't really tried anything over 210lbs yet though I think when you get really high up there though it is going to be rough on your hip bones no matter what
customer_reviews.author: Alena

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! Bought it based on the recommendation of Whitney Simmons - and it’s absolutely amazing. I use it for hip thrusts and anytime I put the barbell on my shoulders. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: V. ray

customer_reviews.title: I use this for cushioning the bar during hip thrusts ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for cushioning the bar during hip thrusts and squats. It's very spongy and prevents me from getting bruises on my hip bones (that was a problem with the cheap-o bar pads at my gym). I've had it 5 months now using it 2-3 times a week and no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Steele

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high density foam
customer_reviews.text: For frame of reference, I do six sets of eight with 250 lbs and this pad feels great. It replaced my old pad that had the Velcro strip to hold it in place. The new pad has much more padding and the cut out for the neck area really helps and makes more sense then the straight pads.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not thick enough for hip thrusts
customer_reviews.text: I wish this bar pad we're a bit thicker. I still get brusies from heavy hipthrusts. I also cannot stand that this company sent three emails trying to get me to review their product.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my gym bag at all times. Makes hip thrusts so much more enjoyable. I can go up in weight without it being painful on my hips.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth It!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, great quality, amazing customer service. I would definitely purchase additional products from this company! If you’ve tried doing hip thrusts but end up with bruises or just experience pain during the exercise, you NEED this! I haven’t had any issues training now. 5/5 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for anyone who lifts
customer_reviews.text: Thank GOD for whoever invented this thing. I was having neck and upper back issues with back squats - forget doing weighted glute bridges with a barbell without it. It has made a tremendous difference in how much I can lift and my comfort during and after.
customer_reviews.author: Hudgens Family

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...
customer_reviews.text: Started out hugging the bar, used itbabfew times and now it doesn't hold its shape. Get the squat sponge- I tried this one, they are about the same price and I wish I didn't. I will probably just give this away and buy the other. NOT WORTH IT
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: BEST barbell pad ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to hip thrust my PR thanks to this pad. This pad is thick enough that you do not feel as much pressure on your pelvic bone.
customer_reviews.author: felicia

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this for hip thrusts. I'm able to add much more weight to my hip thrusts with zero pain. It came with straps so it can be secured onto the bar, but they're not totally necessary to use. Good quality foam, just don't let your cat near it if s/he is a chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Havent been able to use in a gym since they all are still closed but I used the ones at the gym enough to know good quality when I see it. Little bummed orange wasn't an option when I finally bought but the pink isn't bad.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Autrey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bar cushion! Stays put and takes the pressure off my shoulders for squats and lunges and off of my hips for hip thrusts. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH YES!
customer_reviews.text: My gym doesn't have ANYTHING whatsoever for protection while lifting! I purchased & received this product quickly & am BEYOND pleased with it! Size, color, padding, it's all exactly what I needed & IS ACTUALLY AFFORDABLE!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylah Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Hip thrusts?!  So much yes!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t expecting to like this pad when I bought it and that’s mostly because I’m not one to use them when I work out. BUT the necessity for more padding while performing hip thrusts overcame my objection. I am so glad I decided to purchase this. I am no longer putting off certain moves and have overcome my fears. I highly recommend this pad!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Get those hip thrusts in
customer_reviews.text: More efficient than a rolled up mat or anything else, fits in my gym bag, definite good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: saves my pelvic bone
customer_reviews.text: I use this for hip thrust after Whitney simmons recommended it. Does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Juliana nelson

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for barbell hip thrusts. I would have to say it performs as I had hoped, and haven’t had any issues like some reviews mentioned. Plus it came with straps to secure it to the bar, which I was happily surprised with because it didn’t mention that it did.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pad!
customer_reviews.text: I am soooo glad I bought this brand! Definitely worth the money. Most pads I've used for hip thrusts still leave my hips bruised up from the bar, but with this one its such a thick, soft but firm padding, that I can't even feel the bar! No more bruises!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for hip thrusts. Protects my pelvic bones from bruising and allows for better performance. I don't use pads when I squat, but if this can protect my hips, it will be just as protective for your shoulders/neck.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: I think it's too soft for heavy hip thrusts, ...
customer_reviews.text: I think it's too soft for heavy hip thrusts, which is what I bought it for, but other than that it's fine/as described.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Squat bar foam
customer_reviews.text: This foam pad fits perfect. I'd give it 5 starts, but when I attach it to the bar, the split on the foam stays open. It isn't a problem yet, because the foam stays on the bar, but I can see that after a while it will start to slip off. Still though the foam works great.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Aldana

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This helped immensely. I am able to increase weight and have a lot less pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jaz C.

customer_reviews.title: too thin, flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I got this bc Whitney Simmons recommended it way back in the day and bc I wanted my own pad for the gym. however, the quality looked pretty flimsy and torn up when it arrived. anytime I go >250lbs on hip thrusts, I can feel the bar digging in and it gives me hip bruises. so clearly not thick enough. I would return this if I could.
customer_reviews.author: ak99

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical and didn't think it would stay on the bar but it was comfortable and doesn't roll if put on properly
customer_reviews.text: This pad is big and thick. I was skeptical and didn't think it would stay on the bar but it was comfortable and doesn't roll if put on properly. I have a humped vertebra and despite being a gym rat for 10 years and never using a pad, it started to hurt just recently. I think I will now enjoy squatting again
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: This product helps with squats and hip thrusters. Easy to put on and off the bar and seems to be thick in padding.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

product_meta.title: BEAR Strength & Conditioning Next Generation Squat Pad, Comfortable Barbell Sponge for Hip Thrusts, Squats and Lunges
feature_bullets: Barbell neck pad is for every gender and femininity feature of this product makes it unique. Our Barbell Squat Pad reduces discomfort to allow you to workout longer, and with more weight- increasing your gains!
Ergonomic design relieves pain and pressure on your neck, shoulders or hips during exercises like Squats, Lunges and Hip Thrusts.
Thick, high density, non-slip rubber-foam squat sponge absorbs impact and reduces pains! Easily applied to any Olympic-style barbell, and even easier to remove when you want
Quickly install or remove the Barbell pad in the blink of an eye, but remains securely fastened during lifts. Versatile 18"x3.5" pad can be applied to all olympic sized barbells
squat barbell pad helps in weight distribution across the body, relieve pain that occurred in neck while squatting. The quality of this pad is that it helps you do exercise without pain.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
